Skip to contents
itemselectr 0.1
  • Reference

Performs a differential item functioning analysis of polytomous items using ANCOVA

ANCOVA.dif.Rd

Differential item functioning analysis of polytomous items via ANCOVA

Usage

ANCOVA.dif(x, Group, Trait)

Arguments

x

A data frame containing the items. All the items should be scored in the same direction.

Group

A factor indicating group membership

Trait

A vector containing measures of the trait. This may be the total scores across all the items, the mean item scores, factor scores, or IRT person measures.

Examples

library(lordif)
#> Loading required package: mirt
#> Loading required package: stats4
#> Loading required package: lattice
#> Loading required package: rms
#> Loading required package: Hmisc
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'Hmisc'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     format.pval, units
data(Anxiety)

#'### Calculate the Trait score
Trait <- rowMeans(Anxiety[4:32])

#'### Perform the DIF analysis
out <- ANCOVA.dif(Anxiety[4:32], Anxiety$gender, Trait)
out
#> $Results
